title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Bowling Green (Bowling Green, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Had a remote interview with 3-4 people, didn't give clear indication of what information they we're looking for, seemed like they already had a candidate picked and just needed to interview people.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself, that's it.

title: Junior Business Intelligence Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Bowling Green (Bowling Green, OH)
Interview Descriptions: After applying we interviewed via a Teams Video call. The interview was with the hiring manager who later became my supervisor. She only asked a few questions and let it be more open-ended so she could get a feel for my skills and relevant experience.
Interview Questions: How can we help you fit this position into your career plans?

title: Adminstraive Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Bowling Green (Bowling Green, OH) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview in front of a panel of 5 faculty and 1 student. 10 questions or so that pertained to the job. Most questions were not about the past nor future goals.
Interview Questions: If I used budgeting software.

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Bowling Green
Interview Descriptions: There was one interview that lasted 15 minutes. They asked about 6 questions. It overall was a super quick and easy interview process. Two people interviewed me at the same time.
Interview Questions: Why are you applying for this position?

title: Director of Football Operations Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Bowling Green
Interview Descriptions: I first was called by an administrator to set up an interview time that worked for the committee, the committee was open and honest with everything and I had an overall great experience!
Interview Questions: They were very focused on communication and organization styles

title: RAII Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Bowling Green (Bowling Green, OH) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions:
It was great. 
I was given time to express myself and clarify anything they didn't understand. they actually walked me through what my job would be once I was selected for the job.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you are fit for this position?

title: Career Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Bowling Green (Bowling Green, OH) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process had two rounds.  The first round consisted of primarily traditional interview questions with a few behavioral questions about why I was interested in the position, past experience, scenario questions, and my experience working with students.  They also provided an overview of the job description.  The second round interviews were more in-depth behavioral questions that focused on what I would do within the roll to handle my responsibilities, challenges, problems, balancing school with work.  I also had the chance to ask as many questions as I had and was given a tour of the work place.
Interview Questions:
How would you handle working with a student who needed a lot of support?
How would you handle confrontation?
How do you organize and manage all your responsibilities?

title: Student Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Bowling Green (Bowling Green, OH) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interview with all the directors either in person or online. Each one answers a question relating to qualifications needed for a different team on ITS. Networking, student support, service desk, asset management, etc.
Interview Questions: How do you make a peanut butter and jelly sandwich.

title: Assistant Director Career Center Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Bowling Green
Interview Descriptions: Phone first and then on campus. I flew into the Detroit airport and someone from BG picked me up. I got a tour of the campus and also had interviews with different staff members.
Interview Questions: What is your experience working with diverse student populations?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Bowling Green (Bowling Green, OH) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interview was seamless and easy. The hiring and onboarding process was just the same and the transition into the role was perfect. Everyone was helpful and timely with scheduling each interview as well as getting back to me in a timely matter.
Interview Questions: Why would I be a good canidate for this position?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Bowling Green
Interview Descriptions: I had to write a grant proposal and  also i have to  write a final report as well as give a presentation at the end of my project. Overall super easy
Interview Questions: no questions

title: Instructor, College Or University Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Bowling Green (Bowling Green, OH)
Interview Descriptions: It was a group interview. It took 45 min-1 hour. There were three committees.  The candidate introduced herself.  Then, the search committee went over the candidate' CV and research experienced.
Interview Questions: Have you had teaching experienced before?

title: Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Bowling Green (Bowling Green, OH) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Easy sit down with a couple supervisors pretty basic. They will go over roles of the position and ask you basic questions based of the resume. There were three people that were all in there giving information.
Interview Questions: What makes you a good fit?

title: Grounds Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Bowling Green (Bowling Green, OH) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: You sit down with the supervisor and answer questions face-to-face. You must also specify how many days and hours you can work. A drivers licence and class schedule is typically required as well.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for this job?

title: Intramural Sports Official Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Bowling Green (Bowling Green, OH) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied was scheduled for an interview via the school job site, after a week I got a mail that I was to attend a training and interview session.I attended the training...and I'm all set
Interview Questions: Do you like sports

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Bowling Green (Bowling Green, OH) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Apply to the school for your Masters degree. If they need you to fill a teaching assistant role they will ask you. Just make sure you obtain 3 references and you should be good to go.
Interview Questions: Where did you earn your Bachelor's degree?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Bowling Green (Bowling Green, OH) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions:
A phone interview with appropriate questions
Multiple faculty members present during the phone interview
Long time for the approval process for the on-site interview
No certainty about the course load
No mentioning about salary range
Interview Questions: Relevant experience

title: Communication Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Bowling Green (Bowling Green, OH) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very Nice. Cares about the university and its people highly. Really great experience- respectful. Takes you on a tour and introduces you to various co workers. The interview process was in stages...one on one, group, and search committee.
Interview Questions: Why are you choosing Bowling Green?

title: Technical Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Bowling Green (Bowling Green, OH) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions:
After applying for the position I was called after a month to set up the time and date for the interview. The interview comprised of only one round with five panel members. The CIO is also most likely going to be a part of the interview committee. The interview is more focussed on a technical/customer support with a lot of questions on customer service, troubleshooting basic network problems and Macintosh related questions.

The minimum requirement for the job was 2 years.

The company was very unprofessional. After the interview they said they will contact me about the decision after the holidays. The letter came in writing through USPS more than a month later.
Interview Questions:
Expect questions out of the blue. 

"How will you explain to a customer over the phone on how to tie shoelaces?"

title: IT Prep Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Bowling Green (Bowling Green, OH) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: They ask pretty simple IT questions, ports, networking, and hardware. It was relaxed and friendly, no real issues. I would just focus on answering questions as honestly as you can
Interview Questions: What is a MAC address?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Bowling Green (Bowling Green, OH)
Interview Descriptions: It was a graduate assistantship position where your fees were paid in return for a teaching and research position with a stipend every month. We had to write an essay on what we wanted to achieve and then meet other requirements of the university.
Interview Questions: theres wasnt really a difficult question asked . it was pretty straight forward and clear to understand

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Bowling Green (Bowling Green, OH) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions:
1.) Applied online through the website
2.) Panel Phone Interview
3.) In person panel interview; Data presentation with entire office; Interview with senior staff; Campus tour
The process was long but it was not too difficult. It can be intimidating but the staff was friendly.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to deliver bad news to someone in a professional setting.

title: Building Manager of the BTSU Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Bowling Green (Bowling Green, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Was detailed but laid back, I didn't feel nervous to answer honestly. Made the expectations of the job very clear.
Interview Questions: What in your past employment has prepared you for dealing with unhappy customers?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Bowling Green (Bowling Green, OH) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Resume and Interview.
The entire process was very friendly and made the applicant feel both welcome and wanted.
There was a very helpful presentation of the job requirements and the precise nature of responsibilities associated with the position. There was a great opportunity to speak with other instructors as well.
Interview Questions: Ability to handle a wide diversity of students.

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Bowling Green (Bowling Green, OH) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions:
First, you attend an informational session. 
Second, complete grade check (2.5), status with the university, resume, and cover letter. 
Third, first round interviews (2:1) and carousel. 
Fourth, second round interviews. 2:1 
Fifth, Resident Advisor Class. You must obtain at least a C to continue.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself.

title: Coordinator Position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Bowling Green (Bowling Green, OH) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: Online application is screened by a search committee and narrowed down to several candidates.  Phone interview of those candidates allows to narrow down further and the top candidates are invited to campus for a day of face-to-face interviews.
Interview Questions: Why BGSU?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Bowling Green (Bowling Green, OH) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Application was through the universities website, worknet. At the interview, they asked what year you were, how long you were planning on staying at BGSU, what your goals for school are, etc.
Interview Questions: What are your goals for school?

title: Technology Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Bowling Green (Bowling Green, OH) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Q and A, basically learned about me and how I interacted with people and technology.  I wore a suit they were stoked considering that most people that interviewed were pretty lazy.  Great job I enjoyed the learning experience.
Interview Questions: Software experience

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Bowling Green in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: 3 day interview, typical professor process... spoke with ALL faculty in subject area one on one which was nice... Interview go sort of personal at times but only because of information I volunteered...
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Tss Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Bowling Green (Bowling Green, OH) in Dec 2009
Interview Descriptions: It was formal.  They asked very good questions
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Information Technology Services -Student Computer Lab Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Bowling Green in Feb 2009
Interview Descriptions: One interview with Staff Supervisor and one or two student supervisors. Once "hired" you go through a training process where you get paid to attend 2 hour workshops once a week to learn about the labs and procedures, you also complete about 6 hours a week in a lab.
Interview Questions: Most questions relate to either common sense things or relate to the job being so heavily focused on customer service. "What would you do if another student asks you for help with a program you're not entirely familiar with?"
